dt: {bc}an animating or vital principle held to give life to physical organisms
{bc}a supernatural being or essence: such as
{bc}an often malevolent being that is bodiless but can become visible
{bc}a malevolent being that enters and possesses a human being
{bc}temper or disposition of mind or outlook especially when vigorous or animated
{bc}the immaterial intelligent or sentient part of a person
{bc}the activating or essential principle influencing a person
{bc}an inclination, impulse, or tendency of a specified kind {bc}{sx|mood||}
{bc}a special attitude or frame of mind

dt.t: the money-making {wi}spirit{/wi} was for a time driven back

dt: {bc}the feeling, quality, or disposition characterizing something
{bc}a lively or brisk quality in a person or a person's actions
{bc}a person having a character or disposition of a specified nature
{bc}a mental disposition characterized by firmness or assertiveness
{bc}the liquid containing ethanol and water that is distilled from an alcoholic liquid or mash
{bc}any of various volatile liquids obtained by distillation or cracking (as of petroleum, shale, or wood)
{bc}a usually volatile organic solvent (such as an alcohol, ester, or hydrocarbon)
{bc}an alcoholic solution of a volatile substance

pt: {sc}courage{/sc} {sc}mettle{/sc} {sc}spirit{/sc} {sc}resolution{/sc} {sc}tenacity{/sc} mean mental or moral strength to resist opposition, danger, or hardship. {sc}courage{/sc} implies firmness of mind and will in the face of danger or extreme difficulty.
{sc}mettle{/sc} suggests an ingrained capacity for meeting strain or difficulty with fortitude and resilience.

pt.t: a challenge that will test your {it}mettle{/it}

pt: {sc}spirit{/sc} also suggests a quality of temperament enabling one to hold one's own or keep up one's morale when opposed or threatened.
{sc}resolution{/sc} stresses firm determination to achieve one's ends.
{sc}tenacity{/sc} adds to {sc}resolution{/sc} implications of stubborn persistence and unwillingness to admit defeat.

pt.t: held to their beliefs with great {it}tenacity{/it}

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French or Latin; Anglo-French, {it}espirit, spirit{/it}, from Latin {it}spiritus{/it}, literally, breath, from {it}spirare{/it} to blow, breathe
shortdef: an animating or vital principle held to give life to physical organisms
a supernatural being or essence: such as

dt.t: hope and apprehension of feasibleness {wi}spirits{/wi} all industry

dt: {bc}to carry off usually secretly or mysteriously

dt.t: was hustled into a … motorcar and {wi}spirited{/wi} off to the country

shortdef: to infuse with spirit; especially : animate
to carry off usually secretly or mysteriously

dt: {bc}a solution (as of gum arabic in ether) used especially for attaching false hair to the skin

shortdef: a solution (as of gum arabic in ether) used especially for attaching false hair to the skin

dt: {bc}communication by raps held to be from the spirits of the dead

dt.t: Mr. Buell was quite accustomed to reaching his wife in the "spirit world" and the couple frequently communicated through sessions of "{wi}spirit rapping{/wi}," the vehicle being a table.

… while the public responded to the discovery of magnetism and electricity with mystical awe, phenomena such as {wi}spirit-rapping{/wi} were thought possible thanks to the medium being tapped into a source of as yet unknown energy.

shortdef: communication by raps held to be from the spirits of the dead

dt: {bc}a varnish in which a volatile liquid (such as alcohol) is the solvent

shortdef: a varnish in which a volatile liquid (such as alcohol) is the solvent

dt: {bc}automatic writing held to be produced under the influence of spirits

shortdef: automatic writing held to be produced under the influence of spirits

dt: {bc}a spirit or demon that serves or prompts an individual
{bc}the spirit of a dead person invoked by a medium to advise or prophesy

shortdef: a spirit or demon that serves or prompts an individual
the spirit of a dead person invoked by a medium to advise or prophesy

dt: {bc}a person who thinks and acts in an uninhibited way without worrying about normal social rules {bc}{sx|nonconformist||}

dt.t: Their daughter is a real {wi}free spirit{/wi}.
Von der Becke thinks of himself now as a {wi}free spirit{/wi}: a sort of drug-free, hard-working hippie.
Here was a man of extraordinary sensitivity, political acumen, spiritual power, and sexual wildness; a {wi}free spirit{/wi} if ever there was one.

shortdef: a person who thinks and acts in an uninhibited way without worrying about normal social rules : nonconformist
